definition: end/extremity/item/port/to hold sth level with both hands/to carry/regular
to infer easily/to guess at a glance/to get a clue
impossible to get even an outline (idiom)/unfathomable/not a clue

sentences.english: Chongqing is an old industrial base, some of the development of industrial clusters has shown initial signs of a clue.
sentences.chinese: 重慶是老工業基地，某些產業集羣的發展已初見端倪。

sentences.english: Nowdays, science and technology are growing in leaps and bounds, and knowledge economy has shaped it's small form.
sentences.chinese: 當今世界，科學技術突飛猛進，知識經濟已見端倪。

sentences.english: There are new problems on the horizon, just beyond those oil platforms offshore.
sentences.chinese: 就在近海區石油鑽井平臺之外，新的問題已初露端倪。

sentences.english: His writing style can be seen from this novel.
sentences.chinese: 駱賓基的創作風格在這部小說中初露端倪。

sentences.english: Frailty is a killer, and it can start very early in life.

sentences.english: Plans for what's effectively a strategic coal reserve are emerging.

sentences.english: This picture may be able to present a better idea that it is literally impossible to hug a saguaro .
sentences.chinese: 這張或許可看出端倪，爲什麼去擁抱它是不可能的。

sentences.english: The several wars in the cross-century originally show the clue of modern war that is information-based.

sentences.english: Where was the barest inkling of alien biology?
sentences.chinese: 哪裏有哪怕只一點外來生物的端倪呢？

sentences.english: A long, hard battle now looms in the Senate.

sentences.english: Similar laws are brewing in several European countries.

sentences.english: We see a clue in the protesters’ demands for both democracy and economic opportunity.
sentences.chinese: 抗議者要求民主和經濟機會，從中我們可以看到端倪。

sentences.english: Out of this serious social situation emerged the beginnings of modern capitalism.
sentences.chinese: 從這個嚴重的社會境況中出現了現代資本主義的端倪。

sentences.english: China's modernism predestination already saw the clues at that time.

definition: lit. spider's thread and horse track/tiny hints (of a secret)/traces/clue

perspicacious person/sb with a discerning eye/sighted person (as opposed to blind)
item (in a program of entertainments)/trick (act of mischief)/worthwhile result/accomplishment/sth significant but not immediately apparent/sth more than meets the eye
